caption: It used to be a wonderful place to work. I am pursuing a masters in art history and the people on the phone when I called have suddenly rejected my request to study there and use the resources that would help me complete my dissertation- even though I have a certificat de scolarité, carte d’étudiant, etc! The first bibliothèque in Paris that is so unwelcoming and inhospitable to students with legitimate needs to study and gather research . Last time I went I had a letter from my professor and my university library asking them to let me look at a book- even at this time they were very reticent to even let me in the building, which was empty at the time. Shame on you!
Hidden gem of a museum alongside the French Nationale Assembly building.  A very fine collection of Old Master drawings and prints, and always high-quality touring exhibitions along the same lines.
Beautiful building with a very interesting and beautiful collection of drawings and paintings.
Closed when hours on their website said they would be open.

Very nice place. Exhibition on Jacobus Vrel very good scenography the paintings are well highlighted and the booklet at reception is very useful. I saw the 2nd exhibition on the designer Rein Dool, I really liked it. Place to know.

A great museum hidden next to the National Assembly. The exhibition rooms are very well structured, each exhibition has its own booklet with an explanation for each work. There are always two temporary exhibitions for a very affordable price (10 euros full price) and not crowded at all. The staff is very nice. I will definitely come back for the next exhibitions

Interior Decorative Arts, curated by the Rijksmuseum, from 25 February to 14 May 2023. The exhibition hall provides a free guide book, which introduces more than one hundred exhibits in detail, including design manuscripts for silver plates, porcelain, candlesticks, jewelry boxes, wall clocks, picture frames, walls, floor-to-ceiling windows, dressing tables, etc. Some drawings are clear It fully demonstrates the changes from Baroque style to Rococo style and the combination of the two, making people marvel at the ingenuity of architects and painters and the superb skills of craftsmen at that time.

A rare museum that you visit by reservation, except for temporary exhibitions. The mansion contains the immense collection of drawings of the founders and successive directors. The rooms are rich with treasures

JACOBUS VREL EXHIBITION AT THE CUSTODIA FOUNDATION (PARIS)  A dive into the Dutch 17th century  This contemporary artist of Vermeer is presented as his precursor. And the public goes to this mansion on the very chic rue de Lille to find Vermeer there. This is where the trap lies! The comparison does not hold because Vermeer's genius is insurmountable and mysterious and especially because we discover that many other artists painted according to the same references of colors, settings and subjects. It is also one of the interests of this modest (in volume) exhibition to present these other, or almost unknown, artists (Boursse, Gerard ter Borch). Vrel is one of them.  Vrel was “discovered” by a Dutch art historian in 1893. Research began then and to date has not revealed much. This master remains mysterious until his dates of birth and death. Its very name is an enigma appearing nowhere. We cannot identify the places or the cities that he paints (even if experts would have recognized the city of Zwolle in 2021). It adds to the charm! His activity can be verified from the years 1654 to 1662. 45 paintings are attributed to him, 23 of which are presented in Paris.  There we find scenes of life, of the street, of professions, of children playing, of brick facades, of women in their modest interiors busy making pancakes, spinning, chatting among themselves, etc. And, above all this, floats a great melancholic poetry drowned in dark but never disturbing atmospheres. Cats are often present, as are children. A faithful transcription of 17th-century Dutch street life and decor, but marked by the era and its tastes.  The exhibition is not essential due to its brevity and relative originality, but it will suit lovers of this intimate 17th century Dutch work, interested in supplementing their knowledge.  Would you like to have opinions and comments on an exhibition, a film, a museum or a cultural site linked to history? On the “CULTURE AVIS” Facebook page, Gérard GEIST provides personal insight, without tongue-in-cheek, on cultural news. Subscribe. FB: Gérard Geist

As always, beautiful exhibitions of drawings; currently, drawings from the Rijkmuseum in Amsterdam and from the collections of the Royal Museums of Belgium. The best part is that you can read always very interesting comments in a booklet available.

Unfairly unknown to the general public, this independent Dutch foundation offers beautiful exhibitions. A bookstore offering a wide choice of magazines and beautiful art and photography books. Until Dec 17, 2017: CARTIER BRESSON. Seeing your photos in peace is a rare joy.
A place that deserves to be better known. Always very interesting exhibitions.
I never miss an exhibition in this place. Exhibitions that always fascinate me and introduce us to artists little known to the general public.
#ExpositionArt A little-known and timeless place which offers a cultural program off the beaten track to discover. The former Dutch Cultural Center has successfully transformed itself. See you soon.

A charming place offering temporary exhibitions but always of high quality.  Expo Times: Open Tuesday to Sunday from 12 p.m. to 6 p.m. ⚠ closed on Monday.  Library hours: Open Monday to Friday from 2 p.m. to 6 p.m.  I highly recommend!
Magnificent mansion housing the Custodia Foundation. Art history library, exhibitions.

Foundation intended to promote the collections brought together by its creator Mr. Lugt and his wife. Currently exhibiting a magnificent collection of modern Japanese prints from 1900 to 1960. Precision of line, colors and subjects make these works an event not to be missed.

Discovered during my studies in art history, the Custodia Foundation is a very pleasant surprise and a particularly peaceful place. Despite the expensive ticket price, it's a place to go for people looking for exhibitions produced by a community of diverse researchers and curators from around the world. The works exhibited always demonstrate a taste for detail and a passionate eye for art and history. The Custodia Foundation clearly has a favorite subject: Dutch painting. The most striking and most advanced exhibition in terms of scientific research remains that dedicated to the painter Jacobus Vrel. The little booklets given at the entrance are great. Remember to visit all the exhibition floors: the exhibition dedicated to Rein Dool further down in the establishment was a real surprise. To be admired alone or with art history enthusiasts!

I had a great visit which was completely ruined by the security guard who refused me access to the bookstore at 5:50 p.m. I wanted to buy the catalogs for the 2 exhibitions and so I left without having any physical souvenirs following my visit. I understand that the museum closes at 6 p.m. But it would be relevant and even nice to leave the bookstore open 10-15 minutes longer so that the last visitors can buy the books and catalogs. This is actually what is done in quite a few museums, am I asking too much?
There is an exhibition dedicated to the 100th Pushkin Museum, many drawings and sketches by famous artists from the 16th to the 20th centuries.

A foundation to discover. Beautiful exhibition by Jacobus Vrel. The arrangement of the tables is perfect. Despite numerous visitors, access to the paintings is easy, without jostling, as in certain Parisian exhibitions. We appreciated the reduced rate for seniors, which is practiced more and more rarely (Thank you!). A very complete booklet is given at the entrance with a description of the works exhibited (23 paintings out of the 45 existing by this painter). The exhibition ends on September 17, 2023, I recommend it!
Very nice exhibition on Jacobus Vrel which I had not heard of before. Well documented and highlighted, we can appreciate the works unlike in other known Parisian museums. To discover

Superb exhibition on the motif in a very beautiful place. Small catalog offered luxurious enough for everyone to ask if it was free or paid (free at that). In short, excellent time and welcome. Great discovery.
Small discreet foundation near the national assembly which regularly offers temporary exhibitions of good outfits which deserve to be seen.
Museum very well located. The staff are welcoming and friendly. For my part, I went to see the Painting in the Outdoors exhibition, it was a very nice discovery.  Ticket purchases are made on site.

Very nice exhibition. If you like Vermeer, you can't help but like these works by Jacobus Vrel, who was obviously a precursor of the great master (this is almost certain, although the dates remain a little vague). Mnemonic device to remember the name of the artist: Frenchified, Jacobus Vrel almost gives Jacques Brel!

I discovered the Custodia foundation on Saturday for the Jacobus Vrel exhibition. A beautiful setting for a very beautiful exhibition. The only downside was that the book on the exhibition was no longer available...

A stone's throw from the National Assembly, this discreet private foundation deserves more than one visit. In the rooms on the 1st floor and the basement, with immaculate white walls, La Fondation Custodia always presents two exhibitions, distinct or complementary. This institution has a very large collection of remarkable engravings, prints and works on paper, from which it often draws to build its exhibitions. The place is calm, refined, it encourages contemplation of the works while taking your time. On the ground floor, a bookstore presents a selection of books and reproductions of works relating to current and past exhibitions. The staff is very welcoming, courteous, friendly. A civilized place to frequent regularly.
Superb exhibition of drawings from the Pushkin Museum. Excellent welcome. The catalog provided with the tickets is very well done and very useful for understanding the works. Not to be missed.

Always sublime exhibitions in a magnificent setting. I particularly appreciate that a pretty brochure is distributed offering a little word about each of the works presented. Currently, the Pushkin Museum collection delights us with its great wealth and variety. We discover Russian artists little known in France and we appreciate finding the big European names. I warmly recommend!
Do not provide details on the conditions of access to the museum for people with reduced mobility. It would be a shame if disabled people knew whether or not they could come and visit the museum.

Came to see the exhibition dedicated to the French painter Georges Michel. Two stars awarded precisely for the merit of making this little-known painter better known. Three stars removed due to the quality of presentation of the works and in particular because of the catastrophic lighting which almost systematically projects the shadow of the moldings of the frames into the space of the sky of the painting, preventing the eye from traversing without obstacle this that the painter wanted. What are those responsible for presenting the works thinking?
Exceptional place. Superb exhibition...

A foundation, a library and an exhibition space in the same place, just a stone's throw from the National Assembly, with an impressive collection of drawings, engravings and other paintings, many inspired by Flemish art. A great discovery during the exhibition dedicated to Georges Michel!

A must in Paris, a truly coherent collection, adorable staff, an intellectual bath of youth! The exhibitions are modern, airy displays, store with perfect design, make an appointment for a guided tour, you will definitely come back!
Interesting exhibition, the rooms are quite spacious.

Very nice exhibition. On the other hand, the reception is to be deplored. My friend is disabled. She was almost accused of benefiting from free access thanks to her disability card.  This is regrettable.

Very high quality exhibitions. Currently the drawings of the Pushkin Museum in Moscow. 195 treasures. Albrecht Durer and his contemporaries, Italians of the Renaissance, Rubens, Rembrandt, Poussin, Greuze, Renoir, Picasso, Matisse, Chagall, Russians and many others. A wonder.
